$$$DOC.text:
FIXING YOUR OLD LINKAGE EDITOR  (IN DFSMS/MVS TOO)


    Even under DFSMS/MVS, with HEWL and IEWL being the new 'binder',
you can still run the old linkage editor if you say EXEC PGM=HEWLKED.
IBM has kept a version of the old linkage editor around.  However,
with the binder, IBM has removed the old (now stupid) restriction
that object decks can't be blocked greater than 3200 bytes, or 40
records per block.  There were memory restrictions once, that are
now long gone.

    I've looked at my copies of the old linkage editor HEWLKED in
DFSMS, and behold, the old restriction hasn't been lifted or cured.
It is so easy to do!  We had a usermod once, which I am bringing
to you now.  I have two versions of this mod, one for DFSMS 1.0,
and another for DFSMS 1.3.  Both are the same as each other, really.
Also, you shouldn't have any trouble fitting this mod to any version
of the old linkage editor, young or old.  I have also included zaps
for all versions of the linkage editor which I had lying around at
our installation, as well as I could determine.

    VERSION TABLE:

       HDQ1102    -   MVS/370   DFP 1.1
       HDP2230    -   MVS/XA    DFP 2.3
       HDP2240    -   MVS/XA    DFP 2.4
       JDZ1110    -   DFSMS/MVS  1.1.0
       HDZ11C0    -   DFSMS/MVS  1.3.0
       MVS38      -   MVS 3.8j
       MVT        -   OS/360 Release 21.8

    If you have any questions, I'm (hopefully) at:

 Sam Golob                    sbgolob@attglobal.net
 PO Box 906                   sbgolob@cbttape.org
 Tallman, NY 10982-0906

HDP2230.text:
++ USERMOD(MDP223A)  /* ALLOW LKED TO READ OBJ BLKSIZE UP TO 32720) */.
++ VER(Z038) FMID(HDP2230) PRE(UY06768).
++ ZAP(HEWLFINT) DISTLIB(AOS04).
  NAME HEWLFINT
*                       DC    H'3200'
VER 000A4C 0C80
*                       DC    H'40'  ( = 3200/80 = NO OF RECDS/BLK)
VER 000EAA 0028
*                       DC    H'32720'
REP 000A4C 7FD0
*                       DC    H'409' ( = 32720/80 = NO OF RECDS/BLK)
REP 000EAA 0199
  IDRDATA MDP223A
++ USERMOD(MDP223B)  /* ALLOW LKED TO READ OBJ BLKSIZE UP TO 32720) */.
++ VER(Z038) FMID(HDP2230) PRE(UY18525).
++ ZAP(HEWLFAPT) DISTLIB(AOS04).
*                       DC    H'40'  ( = 3200/80 = NO OF RECDS/BLK)
VER 000216 0028
*                       DC    H'409' ( = 32720/80 = NO OF RECDS/BLK)
REP 000216 0199
  IDRDATA MDP223B

MVS38.text:
The linkage editor limit does have a ZAP available for MVS 3.8j:

//HEWLZAP  JOB (HEWL),'HEWL',CLASS=A,MSGCLASS=A,
//             REGION=2048K,MSGLEVEL=(1,1),NOTIFY=HERC01
//SPZAP   EXEC PGM=AMASPZAP
//SYSPRINT  DD SYSOUT=*
//SYSLIB    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.LINKLIB
//SYSIN     DD *
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFINT
  NAME  HEWLF064 HEWLFINT
  VER 000000 90ECD00C05C047F0  the first 8 bytes of the csect
  VER 000910 0C80 the old 3200 blksize
  VER 000D4E 0028 the old blocking factor
  REP 000910 7FD0 the new 32720 blksize
  REP 000D4E 0199 the new blocking factor
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFINT
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFAPT
  NAME  HEWLF064 HEWLFAPT
  VER 000000 E2E3C1D9E3C1D7E3
  VER 000216 0028 the old blocking factor
  REP 000216 0199 the new blocking factor
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFAPT
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFDEF
  NAME  HEWLF064 HEWLFDEF
  VER 000000 D4C4C5C6 the first 4 bytes of the csect
  VER 000008 00030000 the old default size
  REP 000008 00040000 the new default size
  DUMPT HEWLF064 HEWLFDEF

This was provided by Enrico Sorichetti on the turnkey-mvs yahoo group.
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/turnkey-mvs/message/2344

MVT.text:
This version of the linkage editor zap is for OS/360 (MVT):

//IEWLZAP  JOB (IEWL),'IEWL',CLASS=A,MSGCLASS=A,
//             REGION=256K,MSGLEVEL=(1,1),NOTIFY=HERC01
//SPZAP   EXEC PGM=IMASPZAP
//SYSPRINT  DD SYSOUT=A
//SYSLIB    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.LINKLIB
//SYSIN     DD *
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMINT
  NAME  IEWLF440 IEWLMINT
  VER 000000 90ECD00C05C047F0  the first 8 bytes of the csect
  VER 000B28 0C80 the old 3200 blksize
  VER 000F16 0028 the old blocking factor
  REP 000B28 7FD0 the new 32720 blksize
  REP 000F16 0199 the new blocking factor
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMINT
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMAPT
  NAME  IEWLF440 IEWLMAPT
  VER 000000 003C00331C0047D8003D
  VER 0001F4 0028 the old blocking factor
  REP 0001F4 0199 the new blocking factor
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMAPT
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMDEF
  NAME  IEWLF440 IEWLMDEF
  VER 000000 D4C4C5C6 the first 4 bytes of the csect
  VER 000008 00019000 the old default size
  REP 000008 00040000 the new default size
  DUMPT IEWLF440 IEWLMDEF

Adapted by Sam Golob from the example (member MVS38) that was
provided by Enrico Sorichetti for MVS 3.8.  Enrico's source:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/turnkey-mvs/message/2344

Please try it for yourself.  Thanks.  (SG)
